isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION - RS SERIES

svcproc.title: RS SERIES
svcproc.para: In load cushion type Hendrickson suspension systems, road shock is absorbed by four rubber load cushions mounted on support saddles at each side of the vehicle frame ( Figure 6).

When the vehicle is empty, the suspension unit rides on the outer edge of the load cushions. Each cushion has an inner cross bar that progressively contacts the saddle as the load increases ( Figure 7).

The load cushions attach by frame brackets to the vehicle frame. These brackets have saddle bushing drive pins that pass through the load cushions in rubber saddle bushings ( Figure 7). One drive pin passes through each load cushion. The drive pins absorb all driving, braking and cornering forces.

The drive pin bushings are secured in lightweight aluminum saddles. These bushings allow the saddles to move up and down as the load cushions deflect. This maintains lateral, fore and aft alignment of the saddles ( Figure 7).

A heavy-duty cushion option is available on RS-400 (standard with 460 and up) to increase load stability in severe service applications, such as oil field, refuse, transit mix and logging. This option adds one cushion between the existing cushions, and related brackets on each side of the chassis ( Figure 6).

Also, a rebound control stop option is available. This option includes special stop nuts and bumpers to increase stability control on vehicles that have a high center of gravity. The rebound control works by restricting the upward pull of the frame bracket pins and washer into the rubber vertical drive bushings ( Figure 8).
